document_data.name: Surgol Velard
document_data.mainbody: '''Surgol Velard''' was a [[War Wizards|War Wizard]] from [[Suzail]] in [[Cormyr]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Appearance: He was younger than Amarune Whitewave. His voice was a nasal.
document_data.Personality: The man was ambitious, and probably lecherous as well.
document_data.Possessions: He had a ''[[wand of sleep]]'', a slender purse, and a blunt knife, likely used for spreading pastes.
document_data.History:
In the wake of the calamitous [[Council of the Dragon]] at [[Castle Obarskyr]] in the {{YearlinkName|1479}}, Surgol noticed [[Amarune Whitewave]] skulking around the palace. He immediately used a wand to put her to sleep, and had her brought to the [[Mages' Dutychamber]], insisting she not be searched for weapons.

At the Dutychamber, he personally searched her for weapons. While he tried to pry off her clothes, one of the [[Lords of Waterdeep]], [[Mirt]] and the Marchioness [[Immerdusk]], [[Storm Silverhand]], ambushed him and knocked him out, then took his wand.
document_data.Relationship: Surgol was disliked by his fellows [[Joreld Nurennanthur]] and [[Welwyn Tracegar]].
